intro: Alyxia oliviformis var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a woody vine characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are typically 2–5 inches long. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and the presence of stipules at the base of the leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy habitats.
